ANU.name: Hon. Assoc. Prof. Stephen Roberts
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
interest: British history 1815-1914, with a particular interest in Chartism, working class authors and Victorian cities.
ANU.biography: Author or editor of a number of books on Victorian Birmingham - Sir Benjamin Stone 1838-1914: Photographer, Traveller and Politician (2014); Sir Richard Tangye: A Cornish Entrepreneur in Victorian Birmingham (2015); Birmingham 1889: One Year in a Victorian City (2017); Recollections of Victorian Birmingham (2018); and several others.
project: Reviews editor for The Local Historian, the journal of the British Association for Local History, which is published four times a year.

Currently interested in Victorian Birmingham's huge enthusiasm for Shakespeare; and Victorian social mobility through the career of Charles Seely, the 'baker's boy' from Lincoln who at the time of his death owned 10,000 acres of land in the Isle of Wight.
